episodeTitle: The Strongest Family? Luffy's Father Revealed!
description: Garp reveals shocking truths about Luffy's family lineage, including the identity of his father, Monkey D. Dragon, and Shanks' status as one of the Four Emperors. Koby and Helmeppo return, having trained under Garp.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo's Return
events.description: Koby and Helmeppo appear for the first time since the Diary of Koby-Meppo arc, now as trained Marine officers under Garp. Koby is a Master Chief Petty Officer and Helmeppo is a Chief Petty Officer.
events.significance: Shows the growth and development of characters introduced in the very first episodes, demonstrating how they've trained under Garp to become capable Marines.

quotes.text: We've been training under Vice Admiral Garp to become Marine Officers!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Explaining their transformation to Luffy and Zoro

events.title: Garp Revealed as Luffy's Grandfather
events.description: Garp confirms that he is Luffy's grandfather, shocking the Marines who were unaware of this family connection. He expresses disappointment that his harsh training methods didn't inspire Luffy to become a Marine.
events.significance: Establishes the incredible family lineage of Luffy and explains Garp's personal interest in Luffy. This revelation connects the pirate protagonist to one of the Marine's greatest heroes.

quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Confirming the family relationship to Luffy

events.title: Garp's Training Regimen Revealed
events.description: Garp describes his harsh training methods for young Luffy, including throwing him over ravines, leaving him in jungles filled with dangerous animals, and tying him to balloons to make him fly. These were attempts to toughen him up and make him a Marine.
events.significance: Provides insight into Luffy's childhood and explains some of his incredible durability and fearlessness. Also characterizes Garp's extreme training philosophy.

quotes.text: I threw you over ravines, into a jungle filled with dangerous animals, and used balloons to make you fly!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Explaining his training methods to prepare Luffy for manhood

events.title: Garp's 'Fist of Love' Hurts Luffy
events.description: Garp punches Luffy with his 'Fist of Love' technique, which is able to hurt Luffy despite his rubber body. This demonstrates an early form of what would later be explained as advanced combat techniques.
events.significance: First demonstration that Luffy can be hurt by blunt force attacks through certain means, foreshadowing the later introduction of Haki. Though Oda stated it's powered by 'love' rather than Haki, it hints at abilities beyond normal physical attacks.

events.title: The Three Great Powers Explained
events.description: Garp explains the balance of the Three Great Powers: the Four Emperors, the Seven Warlords of the Sea, and the Marines. He reveals that these three forces maintain the balance of power in the world.
events.significance: Establishes the fundamental power structure of the One Piece world and sets up major conflicts to come. This is crucial world-building information that frames the entire series.

quotes.text: The Three Great Powers are the Four Emperors, the Seven Warlords of the Sea, and the Marines. These three forces keep the world in balance.
quotes.speaker: Garp

events.title: Shanks Revealed as a Yonko
events.description: Garp reveals that Shanks, the man who inspired Luffy to become a pirate, is one of the Four Emperors - among the most powerful pirates in the world, on the same level as Whitebeard.
events.significance: Reveals the true status of Shanks, elevating him from a skilled pirate to one of the world's most powerful individuals. This recontextualizes Luffy's first encounter with Shanks and raises the stakes for their promised reunion.

quotes.text: That Red-Haired Shanks you admire so much... he's one of the Four Emperors!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Revealing Shanks' true status to Luffy

events.title: Luffy's Father Revealed as Monkey D. Dragon
events.description: In the episode's climactic revelation, Garp accidentally reveals that Luffy's father is Monkey D. Dragon, the leader of the Revolutionary Army. Garp immediately regrets the disclosure, realizing he said too much.
events.significance: One of the most important revelations in the entire series, establishing Luffy's incredible lineage: grandson of the Marine Hero Garp and son of the world's most wanted criminal Dragon. This connects Luffy to major world events and the Revolutionary Army.

quotes.text: Your father is Monkey D. Dragon!
quotes.speaker: Garp

events.title: Dragon Identified as Most Wanted Criminal
events.description: Robin explains to Luffy that his father Dragon is the leader of the Revolutionary Army, an organization openly opposing the World Government. Dragon has been responsible for overthrowing several monarchies and the World Government labels him as the most dangerous criminal in the world.
events.significance: Establishes Dragon's role as the supreme revolutionary opposing the World Government, making him arguably the most important antagonist to the world order. This sets up future conflicts and explains Dragon's actions in Loguetown.

quotes.text: Dragon is the leader of the Revolutionary Army, and the World Government has labeled him the most dangerous criminal in the world.
quotes.speaker: Robin

events.title: Loguetown Flashback - Dragon Saved Luffy
events.description: A flashback reveals that Dragon was present in Loguetown when Luffy was about to be executed by Buggy. After a mysterious lightning strike saved Luffy, Dragon helped Luffy and his crew escape from Smoker.
events.significance: Recontextualizes events from the Loguetown arc, revealing that Dragon was watching over Luffy and intervened to save him. This shows Dragon's care for his son despite their lack of relationship.

events.title: Luffy Didn't Know He Had a Father
events.description: When asked about his father, Luffy reveals he never knew he had a father, as Dragon never introduced himself. This reveals the absence of any relationship between Luffy and Dragon.
events.significance: Establishes that despite Dragon's intervention in Loguetown, he has never properly met or raised Luffy. This adds complexity to their relationship and raises questions about Dragon's choices.

quotes.text: I didn't even know I had a father!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Responding to questions about meeting Dragon

events.title: Luffy and Koby Reaffirm Their Friendship
events.description: Despite being on opposite sides (pirate and Marine), Luffy reassures Koby of their enduring friendship. This mirrors their parting in the early episodes.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Luffy values his friendships regardless of opposing allegiances, a recurring theme throughout the series. Shows the growth of both characters while maintaining their core bond.

events.title: Garp and Luffy Both Fall Asleep
events.description: Both Garp and Luffy randomly fall asleep in the middle of their confrontation, demonstrating their shared family quirk.
events.significance: A comedic moment that reinforces the family connection between Garp and Luffy through their similar personalities and habits.

quotes.text: Your father is Monkey D. Dragon!
quotes.speaker: Garp

quotes.text: Dragon is the leader of the Revolutionary Army, and the World Government has labeled him the most dangerous criminal in the world.
quotes.speaker: Robin

quotes.text: I didn't even know I had a father!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: That Red-Haired Shanks you admire so much... he's one of the Four Emperors!
quotes.speaker: Garp

themes.description: The episode explores how family connections shape destiny in One Piece. Luffy is revealed to be descended from both a Marine hero and the world's most wanted revolutionary, creating a complex legacy.
themes.symbolism: The three generations (Garp, Dragon, Luffy) each chose different paths (Marine, Revolutionary, Pirate), symbolizing freedom of choice despite family expectations.

themes.theme: The Power Structure of the World
themes.description: Through Garp's explanation of the Three Great Powers, the episode establishes how the One Piece world maintains its balance of power through opposing forces.
themes.symbolism: The triangle of power (Emperors, Warlords, Marines) represents the fragile equilibrium that characters will challenge throughout the series.

themes.description: Garp's disappointment that Luffy became a pirate instead of a Marine reflects the tension between parental expectations and personal dreams, a universal theme.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's rejection of Garp's path mirrors Dragon's earlier rejection, showing a family pattern of independence.

characterSpotlights.development: Garp is established as Luffy's grandfather and a complex character caught between his duty as a Marine and his love for his family. His harsh training methods and disappointment reveal his internal conflict.
keyActions: Describes his harsh training of young Luffy
Accidentally reveals Dragon is Luffy's father
quotes: Your father is Monkey D. Dragon!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy learns shocking truths about his family that he never knew. His casual reaction to having the world's most wanted criminal as a father shows his character - he's unfazed by others' expectations or judgments.
quotes: I didn't even know I had a father!

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's knowledge of the Revolutionary Army and world politics allows her to explain Dragon's significance to Luffy and the crew, demonstrating her value as the crew's scholar.
keyActions: Explains who Dragon is and his role as leader of the Revolutionary Army
Clarifies why Dragon is considered the most dangerous criminal
quotes: Dragon is the leader of the Revolutionary Army, and the World Government has labeled him the most dangerous criminal in the world.

characterSpotlights.development: Koby's return shows his incredible growth from the timid cabin boy in Episode 1 to a capable Marine officer. His reunion with Luffy demonstrates that their friendship transcends their opposing paths.
keyActions: Returns as a Master Chief Petty Officer
Reaffirms their friendship despite being enemies

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added extended flashback sequences to the Loguetown arc showing Dragon saving Luffy, with more detailed animation than the brief manga panels.
Some comedic moments between Garp and Luffy were extended for the anime, including their simultaneous falling asleep.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 432 of the manga, which was titled 'Jack-in-the-Box' (びっくり箱), referring to the shocking revelation of Luffy's father.
Episode 314 has an IMDB rating of 9.1/10, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the series due to the major revelations.
This episode marks the first time Koby and Helmeppo appear since Episode 68, a gap of 246 episodes.
Oda confirmed in the SBS that Garp's 'Fist of Love' hurts Luffy because of 'love' rather than Haki, making it a comedic exception to the rules of the One Piece universe.
The revelation of Dragon as Luffy's father had been foreshadowed since Episode 53 (Loguetown arc) when Dragon saved Luffy, but his identity wasn't revealed until this episode.
This episode aired in Japan on June 17, 2007, and in the US on August 29, 2015 - an 8-year gap due to the initial 4Kids dub ending and Funimation restarting the series.
